Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2007 04:07PM - edited Sep 29, 2007 04:07PM by b445 I had a Lumpectomey no nodes involved. I did 22 weekly CMF treatments and rads. a little over 6 motnhs later I had mets to the liver. But please know that there was now knowing if that would happen or not if I had done a different treatment. Unfortunately this is a guessign game. the Dr.s try there best to give us advise based on previous history from others but no one can tell you for sure that doing one treatment over another will keep the beast away. wishing the best in what ever decision you make

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2007 08:21PM b445 wrote: Bonnie I'll be thinking of you on the 6th. it's an easy date for to remember as it's my Bday. Terry, I think I can relate to the scars not healing. I had my first port taken out in Dec. A year after my first round of treatment. In May this year I had a new port put in. It never healed and they wound up taking it out and putting a new port on ther other side. They new port is healing well but the old site is again not healing and they are holding treatment to see if it will heal. So far it doesn't look good. Bonnie What thinners are you on? I take coumadin except before a surgery then I have to stop it and start Lovenox shots until the day before a surgery. Then surgery night start back up on the coumadin and keep taking the shots until the comadin levels are back up to par. Pain in the stomach! I did the shots for 6 months but told them when I got more clots and they told me I had to stay on thinners I wouldn't do the shots unless I had to So glad many of you are done or almost done with chemo. Mine will go on for some time to come. Rads are quick and easy they main thing is to keep the area moisterized and clean. They last couple weeks may get hard but it's doable and your strength will return. I've seen some of you wonder over to the Wagon Circle in Moving beyond. It's a great place for anyone that is dealing with the beast weather you are just begining treatment in the middle or continueing. I hope to see more of you there too! Hugs & Prayers
Posts.Title: June 2007 Chemo b445 GracieM2007

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2007 09:01AM b445 wrote: Terry, we had PINKSTOCK '07 at MB's last summer and my do it again next summer it was a blast to meet so many from the boards. I think there were 16 of us plus families. We had a light snow last night but they say it will really hit later today. I hope not since I have to be out there for a concert. Chemo is going well and I can tell I'm back into it. I had an MRI for the brain yesterday and was told I have 5 new spots that need to be treated. I see the neuroseurgon on Monday. Does the fun ever end?

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2007 05:06PM b445 wrote: Terry, you should connect with Purple MB she is also from Western NY, Ischua I believe. She is a fantasitic lady! Normal, Is life ever Normal? I found life always changing the kids growing up and moving out, Job changes, Life cycle changes. MIL developing Dementia, BC. Menopause. Life is always changing around us. There are new challanges all the time. It's what you do with the changes that make life normal for you. I think that's one way the Wagon Circle has helped me with the new Normal. It's part of why I menttion it all the time. The gals there try to be supportive and yes occasional have a minor spat. That's life that's Normal! Normal is my checking up on you ladies and glad to see that a bond has developed. Normal is when the chemo is done and the rads are done you feel a little lost. (That's because we've had so much attention during active treatment) Normal is learning to Move Beyond and still maintain the friendships developed along the way. Some folks will say "Why do you obsess with that site?" It'sd not an obession it's a way to deal with the new Normal. How do I know? Well you see my journery, and that's what this is started 2 years ago. I went through 22 weeks of chemo. I went through 36 days of Rads. I went through the I'm done I'm Free, now what do I do? I went to the Moving Beyond: Time To Circle The Wagons thread and I found many that had gone through what I did. I found some that had the dreaded Beast return or spread, or a new Beast appear. I met gals that were just trying to cope with the daily life we all faced but were'nt ready to give up the community that gave so much Hope and Love when they needed someone to "Get It" like no one else other than a survivor can. All I can say is I'm glad I have them to be there as I go through this again. They get it and I'm really grateful to have them to call friends. Try it out! Don't lose the friendships that have developed. Feed them and be a support for each other. Rads are really pretty easy. They mark up all over like a roap map them take xrays and simulate how the rads bean will go. once all this mapping is done you go in lay on the table with your arms above your had they set the machine up they leave the room the machine comes one they may move they machine for another angle then it zaps, (you don't feel it) you again and your done for the day. They may take xrays once or twice a week and you see the rad onc once a week. Pretty simple you in and out in no time. the biggest hassel is it's 5 days a week for about 6 weeks. Be sure to use aloe of something like it to keep the skin moisturized as you go through treatment. Most get through without any problems some burn a little. like a mild sunburn. I'm so happy to hear most everyone is done with their chemo and will get to move on to the next steps. Well I've really just gone on rambling tonight, must be the pain meds. Hugs and Prayers

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2007 07:26PM b445 wrote: Cyndi, You are the last! I will be continueing with Chemo for a while longer. No end date was given for me. My hair is a little over 1/4" now it's so soft and fuzzy. My grandkids love to run their hands through it and my hubby snuggles it whenever he can. I've heard a lot of gals have curly hair when it comes back so far mine is straight. Since I've done rads before I'd be happy to answer any questions I can. Deb the NW was indeed beautiful this last weekend. But I hear the rains are coming again. I had frost Thurs & Friday. So was glad not to wake up to it again today. I don't like the cold much and always look forward to summer. I'm in the Seattle area.

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2007 07:51PM b445 wrote: Today Scott, Charlene & I went and saw the neurosurgeon. We looked at the MRI done on Nov 30th compared to the one done last May. There are at least two large spots and a lot of small spots on the newsts MRI that were not seen on the one in May. The spots are cellls that got into the brain and have swelled putting pressure. It is not brain tisse that has gone bad. Because of the number of spots it may not be best to go the Gamma Knife route but rather to go the whole brain radation route and if need to done the road go gamma knife. They did another MRI today with a finer look to see if they can tell what the smaller spots are. At any rate I have a very hard and long road to recovery in front of me. Most likey I will have to quit working as some fuctions may be limited. it can be a few months to a year before we will know all of the affects. My goal right now is to maintain as much of a normal life as I can and spend time with family. I fell there is still a lot left for me to do and my time is not yet here. I ask that you keep my family in your prayers as this will be as hard on them as it will be on me. In some ways harder I think for them. Financially this id going to be very difficult but I trust the good Lord will see us through. I will know more in the days to come as to how we will proceed with treatment. Right now I'm going to concentrate on cleaning out my house and making things as simple as possible. I've got a lot of stuff to get rid of  and make room for family to be here if they want to be. well that's all I know for now Love Cy
Posts.Title: June 2007 Chemo b445 GracieM2007

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2007 09:41PM b445 wrote: I do belive that God will see me through and with all the prayers headed his way how can he but not listen. We are praying hard that the insurance company will pay for the Gamma Knife Rads as there are at least 10 visiable spots as seen on the test done yesterday. It is prefferd to go that woute first and if need be in a month of so go the whole brain rads. So if you dont mind I will ask that your prayers be directed at the insurance company allowing the first option to be paid for. What ever we do we are trying to get it all done before the year is out so that most of it will be covered by the insurance company before we have to start all over with deductibles and copays. Thank you all for your support and continued prayers. Shrink so gald you are at home I know the drains are a pain but they won't be there to long. Keep tack of how much you empty and in now time it will be down low enough for them to be removed. Hope everyone else is doing well. I'm thinking of you and praying for you too.

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2007 02:09PM b445 wrote: I'm on port #3 I had my first port taken out after 1 year, after all seemed clear. I had port #2 put in the same spot, (this may have been my problem, There was a lot of scar tissue), May of 2007. It never healed righ and got infected about 3 moth in. after several rounds of antibiotics they decided it had to come out. Oct 1 2007 and a new one was put in on the other side the same day. The old site never healed. in fact I'm seeing a wound Care specialist right now. They held 5 weeks of chemo while trying to get this to heal. They just started my chemo, (Abraxane) back but are still holding the Avastin. THey will have a plastic surgeon close the hole I have from the port that never healed. I'm sure they will hold your avastin but may continue with your chemo. What ever they do stay on top of how it looks. You have to be your own advocate! Best wishes healing and Prayers

Posts.Title: June 2007 Chemo b445 GracieM2007

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2007 06:04PM b445 wrote: The gamma knife is usually done for 5 or less spots. Then they found 10 then the final count was 15 so we weren't sure is the insurance would cover it or think this is experimental. Thank The GOOD LORD that they are going to cover it. It's a big relief! The next option was full brain rads wich has more side effects. So we were really praying for the gamma knife. There is a possiblitiy they could do it again but not as likely. All we can do is hope and pray that this worked and when they change my chemo late Jan that it will do the trick to keep the mets at bay. I have family in form out of town so may not be able to get on as often. But please let me know that my prayers and thoughts are with you. Hugs & Prayers & Happy Holidays

Posts.Title: brain Mets b445 celia088

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2007 09:06PM b445 wrote: I will be doing the Gamma Knife Rads tomorrow and if need be I can always do the whole brain at a later time. I'm nervous but know that I will get through this fine. How can I not when I have all the outpouring of love and prayers coming in. Thank you so much Hugs & Prayers
Posts.Title: brain Mets b445 celia088

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2007 01:59AM b445 wrote: Today Scott, Charlene & I went and saw the neurosurgeon. We looked at the MRI done on Nov 30th compared to the one done last May. There are at least two large spots and a lot of small spots on the newsts MRI that were not seen on the one in May. The spots are cellls that got into the brain and have swelled putting pressure. It is not brain tisse that has gone bad. Because of the number of spots it may not be best to go the Gamma Knife route but rather to go the whole brain radation route and if need to done the road go gamma knife. They did another MRI today with a finer look to see if they can tell what the smaller spots are. At any rate I have a very hard and long road to recovery in front of me. Most likey I will have to quit working as some fuctions may be limited. it can be a few months to a year before we will know all of the affects. My goal right now is to maintain as much of a normal life as I can and spend time with family. I fell there is still a lot left for me to do and my time is not yet here. I ask that you keep my family in your prayers as this will be as hard on them as it will be on me. In some ways harder I think for them. Financially this id going to be very difficult but I trust the good Lord will see us through. I will know more in the days to come as to how we will proceed with treatment. Right now I'm going to concentrate on cleaning out my house and making things as simple as possible. I've got a lot of stuff to get rid of  and make room for family to be here if they want to be. well that's all I know for now Love Cy
Posts.Title: brain Mets b445 celia088

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2007 12:05AM b445 wrote: I like the one "you can have my sticker if you take my Cancer!" Didn't know we may be eligable for special treatment like preboarding and parking? Never thought of that. I know my dad often looks very healthy but because of a heart problem has a parking plaque. some people however use other peoples plaques to try and get closer parking. I think I would have said do you want to see my permit,(cause you have to have one in your wallet), and shall I report you for stalking me!

Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2007 02:52PM - edited Oct 2, 2007 02:52PM by b445 Well the old port is out and a drain in place of it on one side and on the other side a new port. I get the abraxane tomorrow in the new port. I have to chechk to see when they plan to start the avastin back up. Starting to hurt so think I may lay back down hope all are well
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2007 10:59PM b445 wrote: The new port site is healing pretty good. I have a really ugly bruise from it but that was the way the other ports looked about two weeks out too. The old site though is what has me concerned. It looks black again! I take the last of the antibiotics tonight. Dr. Hickman put all the stitches on the inside and used glue to hold the top skin together. I'm allergic to all the steristips and other tapes and adhesives they tried to use. I really don't care about ugly scars I just want them to heal! I've been on one antibiotic or another since Aug 22nd other than 5 days one time and 7 days another time! So I'm a bit amprehensive taking the last one tonight. The treatment hasn't been that bad. the not healing is what bothered me we wated about 6 weeks on the port that was placed in May before we started the avastin. I wonder if being on blood thinners has anything to do with it not healing well????
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2007 08:23PM b445 wrote: SE's have been nuropthay (sp) which the Onc has me taking 10g 3x day of L-glutamine, nails that have changed color and looks like I may loose soon. I keep them really short and have to cover them with bandaides at times. very very sore feet. They feel bruised and very dry. have trouble wearing anything but ope toes wide shoes. I get to feeling yucky on the 2second day after treatment. My hip also hurts not sure what from. I'm also doing the nupogen shots 3 days a week. ( I hate doing shots) Been doing the lovenox shots for almost 3 weeks now too because of a surgery I did and they can't get the coumadin levels back up right. Hope fully tomorrow's INR will be high enough that I can stop those shots. I'm really very tired after starting back up. I had a 2 week break and it's playing havoc with me this time.
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2007 11:40PM b445 wrote: Well another treatment is done. I think they like to do these treatments in block of 12 Abraxane and 6 Avastin. That's what I keep hearing from the nurses. They also said that a lot of people don't have bad  side effects from it. They did lower the amount I was getting several weeks back because the neuropthy was so bad I could hardly walk. Since then it's been better. I still have it but I can walk and I can still crochet which the nurses like to see me doing. I still work close to 40 hours a week and try to take it easy on the weekends.
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: b445 wrote: Some where there was a thread about a trial of Abraxane and Avastin combo. I am hearing about more people being treated with this combonation. In April I was dx'd with liver mets. they choose this combo for me in weekely doses of the abraxane and every other week of the avastin. Aug 31 I got the new that the combo is WORKING! the tumors are shrinking! I have to continue the treatments for another 12 weeks before they will do the scans again. Hopefully Thanksgiving will bring more good news. Is anyone else doing this weekly? Smile you will surely make someone day! Dx 4/24/2007, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2007 09:00PM - edited Oct 4, 2007 09:00PM by b445 Linda, thanks for asking about me. I'm feeling much better today. The bandages came off both sides today. They felt it would be better to have them off so I can watch the sites for any signs of infection, that and the adhesive was tearing up my skin! The sites are tender but look really good! Better than the old site has ever looked! I did #15 last night. they used the new port but it took 3 times for them to get it accessed with good return, duh it was still swollen from the placement on Monday! I sure love the nurses that run the abraxane with the iv flush at the same time it sure makes it go much faster. The abraxane takes forever for them to mix and that can make for a long night. Haven't been real good at taking my L-Glutamine and man o live does the neuropthy flare up when I miss taking it. hope to keep this thread going for those that are looking at abraxane as I had trouble finding info on it when I was looking for it. Hope you all feel the same way. Hugs and prayers

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2007 10:48PM b445 wrote: I felt really bad this weekend but I don't think it was starting back up on the chemo. there's something going around out here
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2007 10:11PM b445 wrote: My Onc cleared it with the insurance co before we started. Just told them that this was the best they could do and it was what I needed so the ins co say Ok. Have you tried the L-glutamine for the neuropthy? My onc wants me taking 10 grams 3 times a day. I get about 2 times a day done. It's sold in the health food stores and isn't cheap. you can get it in capsules and in powder form. if yo can handle milk shakes the podwer is the cheapest way to go and mixes in the shakes well. I was mixing it with my juice and it was a bit gritty. can't do milk shakes although I wish I could. It has helped though. I've notices a big difference in when I take it and when I don't. I go in for #14 on the abraxane and #6 on the avastin tomorrow. I also do the neupogen shots 3 times a week at home. Man I'm getting tired of those. But I work full time and need to keep my counts up. I get the port evaluated on Thursday. so we'll see what they say about it. It's one of those Power Ports, (they can do CT's with it)
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2007 11:32PM b445 wrote: Yes, It's wierd sometimes I sound so strange that I have trouble talking on the phone which I must do for work! I also have a bit of a dry cough off and on!
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2007 11:48PM b445 wrote: Linda be sure to get your self really hydrated that will help with the veins, plump them up as it were. I did Abraxane #16 today. If all is looking good I start back up on the avastin next week. I have some concerns about that as I just had the port replace on the 1st. but well see. I woke up with really sharp pain at the new port site on Sunday night and then Monday night woke up screaming when I found myself face down and the pain racking my port site and I couldn't get turned over in bed by myself. took both hubby and me to get me turned over and I was just in tears. got up and then put in 11 hours at work came home and collasped last night. Well it's off to be as I have a long day again tomorrow hugs and prayers and Hope you all are doing well
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2007 10:56PM b445 wrote: I've had the neuropthy so bad I couldn't walk. they keep using the same chemo but cut back the dose and I've done much better since. I also take the neurontin, 900mg but I take it all at night when I go to bed, cause it does make me dizzy. I actually started taking it for the hot flashes over a year ago.  The l-glutamine is a free form amino acid that helps the muscles. A lot of body builders use it right after exercise to help keep the muscles from breaking down. I'm suppose to take 10g 3 times a day which is 18-20 capsules each time or about 2 tablespoons of the powder. I can't drink shakes so I take the pills. It's a bit pricey so I get the powder and fill the capsules myself. I haven't heard about b-6 or glucosomine helping I'll have to ask my onc if I can take those. I finished all the antibiotics they had given me and the old port site is still seeping so they gave me more antibiotics and they will check it tomorrow and the onc will see me next week unless it gets worse! Tomorrow will make #17 of the abraxane. they are holding the avastin for at least one more week if not more. Hope that doesn't delay them doing the scans to see how I'm doing. Linda, I just noticed you did #17 too. How are you doing with it? hugs & Prayers
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2007 02:20PM b445 wrote: Well after several weeks of holding my chemo we started it back up on the 14th. I don't look forward to the SE's again but it has to help shrink these tumors. I believe they were starting to grow again. I've got a lot of hair back I wonder if I will loos it all over again. should be interesting to find out. It's just hair and I lived without most of it before. The old port sit looks bad it's now about 1 x 2 x 3/4 they are going to have a PS close it up soon. But at least it's started to heal fininally. I went to a wound specialist and feel much better about it. Hope all are doing well Hugs & Prayers
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2007 11:33PM b445 wrote: Well it's now been 3 treatments since I started back oon the abraxane. They won't start the avastin back up becuse of the open wound from the old port site. but thats ok for now. They old site is still ugly and being treated by the wound clinic and hopefully it will clear up the rest of the way soon. I have an appointment with a plastic surgeon to see if they can do anything to help it close and heal on Friday. That should be interesting. Never thought I'd say I'd be glad to be back on chemo but if being off it caused they pain I've had then I'm glad I'm back on it cause yesterday I felt down right GREAT! A bit tired today but that is expected. Hugs and prayers to all
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2007 10:21PM b445 wrote: I also had the small blisters. Mine started on my elbow and then I had a few on my figers. I just covered the ones on my fingers with badaides to keep them from rubbing. they got hard then they peeled. I didn't have them long though. My markers have been elevated but I hear that is not uncommon while in treatment. I am having problems with the port incesion site. it never heald fully and got infected twice in the last month. Now I have to go back to the Dr. that put it in to have him decide if my body is rejecting it and if I'll need a new one. I hope not. I never had any problems with my first one. Sometimes wish I never had it taken out. I've now done 13 abraxane and 5 Avastin since the end of May. I've only missed 4 weeks of treatement in all that time. The first because the neuropothy was so bad.  They lowered the dose after that, the second to give me a break when I flew back to NY and the 3 & 4th because my port site was infected. Abraxane is doable, I have what I call chemo nose which means it runs a lot and leaky eyes both of which I experianced with CMF when I did that last year. Hope everyone is doing well
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2007 10:26PM b445 wrote: Yes I take the L-glutamine every day. I also take neurotin daily too. Although I started it for hot flashes. I've been surprised to see how much hair has grown back this last month. I wonder if I'll loose it again! I know hair grows in 3 month cycles. I got rashes but I thought they were from the Abraxane. They come and go. Mostly on the hand and elbows,(which was new for my onc). Benadryl helped  I know they  lowered the amount of Abraxane when the neuropthy got so bad I couldn't walk. My port site is still abecessing in one spot and I have to remove the top layers of scabs so that it can drain twice a day and now it's infected up the catheter again. The On Cal Onc was nice enough to call in a RX rather than make me go to the ER. Which made me really happy as I had family plans today and didn't want to cancel but if I had gone to the ER I would have had to because I would have been to tired. Wow Cjay over a year on this. I sure hope you get the 6 months stable and this has done the trick for you.
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2007 10:34PM b445 wrote: Got the word they are going to delay my avastin a week do to the port removeal / placement. I'm glad cause I really want these incesions to heal!
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2007 10:47PM b445 wrote: I don't do premeds but have been given some compazine for if the neasua gets to me. It usually doesn't. and I can take benadryl if needed
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2007 10:19PM b445 wrote: Evening all. HAd my monthly visit with Onc yesterday. She's holding my chemo this week becasue the old port site is not healing. They will check it next week and decide if they are going to hold it nect week. guess we are going to do this week by week until we see some improvement. She ordered CT's and another Bone scan to check the progress before I see the Onc again next month. Just waiting to get the dates scheduled. My hair is growing back nicely. I don't wear the scarves and hats now unless I'm outside cause it's cold out now. Hope everyone is doing well Hugs & Prayers
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2007 09:17PM b445 wrote: my mets arre to the liver I'm doing the weekly treatments but am only on #18 as I have had so many weeks break. Don't let the markers get you down. There are many reasons a marker can go up, you may have just had a cold or maybe the flu shot or taken more tylonal than before. so don't let the markes get you down they are just tools to help the guide the Onc.
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63
